newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy yen bond saw good demand, all placed in Japan.
newsitem.headline: Italy yen bond saw good demand, all placed in Japan.

text.p: Italy's 100 billion yen 20-year bond issue launched on Tuesday saw good demand and was entirely placed with Japanese institutions, a source close to the Italian Treasury said.
"This operation had an ideal combination of long duration and low yield," the source said.

The 3.7 percent Euroyen issue, priced at par and lead managed by Nomura International, had a spread of 22 basis points over JGBs of the same maturity, against a spread of 51 bps seen in Italy's previous Euroyen deal in May 1995.
The source said this latest deal brought the total of Italy's foreign currency denominated bond issues to the equivalent of $11.6 billion, near the Treasury's target for $12-15 billion in 1996.

As for further foreign currency bond issues before the end of this year, the source said this would depend on market conditions but the Treasury would try to meet its goal. -- Milan newsroom +392 66129589
